alert.note: Alert for Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 06 at 7:59PM MDT until August 07 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO HOT, DRY, WINDY, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS... .A very unusual period of critical fire weather is expected to continue through Tuesday evening as exceptionally dry westerly flow impacts northern New Mexico. Hot, dry, windy, and unstable conditions will occur again for several hours Monday afternoon and evening across the northern high terrain, surrounding highlands and upper Rio Grande Valley. The potential exists for similar conditions may exist Tuesday afternoon and evening over the Northwest Plateau and North Central Mountains. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121) on Monday from 11 am to 8 pm MDT. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...9 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
